text:
*[Bug 18892] Support the use of netrc when using the libcurl downloader?*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18892>

--- Comment #4 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Also it seems there have been some security vulnerabilities related to netrc
files in curl (leaking secrets):

<https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-11053.html>
<https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2025-0167.html>

I am wondering whether simply using .netrc files could be perceived as a red
flag by some security reviewers.

Perhaps extending R to allow passing secrets from (an external) password
manager to libcurl would be better (despite much more work)? In principle,
someone could then even provide an implementation that would parse .netrc files
for this, but more sophisticated implementations could be used as well.
Arguably it would make sense having such functionality already upstream in
libcurl - say allow setting callbacks to get login/password for a given URL.
